info.title: What is Coverage?
info.description: With Revoke.cash, we help you manage your risk in the crypto space. We offer tools to help you prevent getting drained or losing funds. But even then, scams and hacks do occur. That is where coverage comes in. Coverage is a way to make sure that the value of your wallet is covered in case of a wallet drain. Several types of coverage exist, from smart contract hacks to phishing attacks. We've partnered with <fairside-link>Fairside</fairside-link> to offer you coverage in case of some phishing and social engineering drains, but other coverage products exist for smart contract hacks, such as <nexus-link>Nexus Mutual</nexus-link> or <bright-union-link>Bright Union</bright-union-link>.

quiz.title: Quick Coverage Quiz
quiz.start: Take Quick Quiz to Get Started

main.title: Wallet Drain Coverage
main.description: Get paid if you get drained. Fairside is the first crypto native coverage platform that allows you to purchase coverage for your wallet in the case of drains. They cover various loss events under phishing and social engineering delivery methods.

important.title: Important Information
important.kyc: KYC is only required when creating a claim, not when purchasing coverage.
important.coverage_amount: Coverage is purchased in ETH amount - if your portfolio value rises in ETH, you're still only covered for the original ETH amount.
important.fee: There is a 10% Personal Responsibility Fee on payouts.
important.wallets: You can have up to 10 wallets covered, but you have to add each one after purchasing coverage!

info.description: Sessions are a permissions system similar to token approvals, but with a few key differences. While token approvals specify a permission for an address to take tokens from your wallet, sessions can be used to specify a permission for another address to sign specific transactions on your behalf when interacting with smart contracts. These sessions are currently only available on Abstract when using the Abstract Global Wallet, but might be available on other chains in the future.
info.title: What Are Sessions?

policy_type.all: This session is authorized to call {callPoliciesCount} different functions and transfer tokens to {transferPoliciesCount} different addresses
policy_type.calls: This session is authorized to call {callPoliciesCount} different functions
policy_type.transfers: This session is authorized to transfer tokens to {transferPoliciesCount} different addresses

info.description: Signatures are a way to authorize actions without sending a transaction. Marketplace signatures are used to list assets for sale on marketplaces like OpenSea. Permit signatures are used to grant token approvals. Because these signatures are not stored on the blockchain, there is no way for Revoke.cash to know if you signed them. This page contains a list of marketplaces and a list of your tokens that support offchain Permit signatures. Only if you know that you signed an offchain signature on a scam website, you need to cancel the potential signatures on this page, otherwise you are wasting transaction fees. When you cancel potential signatures for a token or marketplace, they will remain in the list but cannot be cancelled again for some time.
info.title: What Are Signatures?

marketplaces.active_approvals: {count, plural, =1 {1 active approval} other {# active approvals}}

tooltips.marketplace_signatures: Once approved, marketplaces are able to move assets on your behalf. Bad actors exploit these approvals to create zero-priced listings on third party websites. Cancel these if you signed a marketplace signature on a phishing website.
tooltips.old_approval: This approval is over a year old. Consider revoking it if you no longer need it.
tooltips.permit2_expiration: This is a Permit2 approval that will expire {inTime}
tooltips.permit_signatures: Permit Signatures are used to grant approvals without sending a transaction. Cancel these if you signed a Permit signature on a phishing website.
tooltips.recently_cancelled: You already cancelled this potential signature recently. It will remain in the list so you can cancel it again later if you need to.
tooltips.switch_chain: Please switch your connected network to {chainName} inside your wallet to continue

why_tip.description: Revoke.cash is a 100% free and open source public good. To keep it that way, we rely on your donations. We are very grateful for your support! 🙏
